message.content: {"id": "3970", "title": "Bug 3970[preferences] UI needed to define the default line delimiters for new files (1GFIOAX)", "description": "Bug 3970[preferences] UI needed to define the default line delimiters for new files (1GFIOAX) the Windows work stations are used as X terminals and to run Eclipse (since PC are cheaper than Unix boxes).", "OB": "Currently, when a new file is created on Windows, it does not have Unix line delimiters, which is problematic because the end product is a Unix product. ", "EB": "The UI should provide a preference setting to define the line delimiter for new files. The options for line delimiters should include Dos/Windows, Mac, Unix, and the default platform line delimiter. This UI should be provided by the Workbench to ensure consistency across all plugins' usage of line delimiters for new files.", "SR": ""}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '3970', 'title': 'Bug 3970[preferences] UI needed to define the default line delimiters for new files (1GFIOAX)', 'description': 'Bug 3970[preferences] UI needed to define the default line delimiters for new files (1GFIOAX) the Windows work stations are used as X terminals and to run Eclipse (since PC are cheaper than Unix boxes). ', 'OB': '', 'EB': 'even if the new file is created on Windows it should have Unix line delimiters since the end product is a Unix product.There should be a UI (Preference) to define the line delimiter for new files. Possible values are: Dos / Windows Mac Unix default platform line delimiter.The UI should be provided by the Workbench since all plugins should use the same line delimiter for new files.NOTES: ', 'SR': ''}
